title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: South Park, day. People mill around, but a group of them has gathered around a magician, tall and slender, with a severe face

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Okay, Carol, put the card you picked back into the deck so I can't see ittwah.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What's going on?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Uh this feller David Blaine. He's doin' magic tricks. Hey, where'd you get that ice cream?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Okay, now hold this card up to the crowd. Was that the card you picked?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No, I'm sorry. I picked the four of hearts.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Four of hearts? Really? Look again.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Daa-ah!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oooohhhh!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Whoa

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's pretty cool, dude!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Who's this asshole?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He's a magician named David Blaine, dude. He kicks ass.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hey, where'd you guys get that ice cream?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sir, c- could you come over here?  Now, what I want you to do, Mr...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kern.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mr. Kern, I want you to just... think about a card. Pick any card, and picture it in your mind.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: O-kay.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Okay, jus... s think about your card. okay, look at me.  Look at me... Look at me... okay, now reach up your ass.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Huh??

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Go on, reach up your ass.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Uh, I don't feel nothin'.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Deeper.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hhud. I don't feel... hello... wait... wait...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Was that the card you picked?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yes! Oh my God!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: O-hoho!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wow, that's cool!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: How'd he do that??

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Thank you. I've been traveling from town to town for quite a while. I've started quite a following, mostly because of my levitation tricktwah. Watch. Watch.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Whoa!!!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No way!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Damn. That guy is the coolest guy in the universe!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Pamphlet. Pamphlet. Here you go, kids, take a pamphlet.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: "David Blaine Workshop. Learn all about David Blaine at the Center for Magic." Dude, we gotta go.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yeah, and they probably teach you how to do magic tricks!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, in the middle of nowhere, day.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hello, everyone. My name is Steven and I've been a Blainetologist for about three years. So, when David Blaine performed his miracles out on the street, what moved you the most?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: His a-miracles?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh yes, you see, David Blaine is much more than a magician. He's a scholar, a visionary, a leader.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: When are we gonna learn magic tricks?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yeah!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, I've got a trick for you to learn: I can show you how to make your true self appear. Let me ask you all something: Do you consider yourselves to be happy?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I don't think I'm very happy. I always fall asleep to the sounds of my own screams.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: ...Right, yeh. Eh, see, the reason that you are unha-

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: And then I always get woken up in the morning by the sounds of my own screams. Do you think I'm unhappy?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wait, the.. the point is... that you can be happy. You see, your friends and parents have programmed you in a way that makes you feel isolated and alone. How many times have you felt like nobody knows the real... you? You're not really happy.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'm not really happy.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Your potential hasn't even been reached.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: My potential hasn't even been reached.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: If you look through David Blaine's incredible book, you'll find a lot of life's answers. Let's read some of the book together, shall we?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Then we get to be in David Blaine's secret club?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's right.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cool.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle's house, day. In the dining room, Sheila is trying to feed Ike, who is in a baby chair.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ike, eat your gefilte fish.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No-oo.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mom. Mom. I found out all about this great new magician named David Blaine:

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's nice, Kyle. Ike, eat!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: We spent all afternoon learning about how we aren't actually happy. I had no idea how unhappy I was until today. They gave me this cool book to read, and I'm already on chapter four..

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Well, it's nice to see you so interested in something, Kyle. Ike, for the love of Abraham, you are gonna eat this.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: So can I go to the Magic Camp, to learn how to become a full member? All the other guys are doin' it, and it's only $69.95.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Magic Camp? I don't know, bubbe, ask your father.  Ike, you will eat this!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, in the middle of nowhere, day. The new recruits are having their hair shaved off their heads

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Prepare to be cleansed and release the magic inside you.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I am prepared.  Hoh, jeez, eh it sure got cold in here.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Next?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, main room

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Congratulations, young Blainetologists. From this day, you are clean.  Now, we have very important work to do! David Blaine is going to put on a big magic show in Denver tonorrow night, where he's going to eat his own head.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wow!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: So it's up to all you new Blainetologists to get as many people there as you can. Whoever gets the most people to come gets a prize!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle, I'm starting to think that this is a really bad idea.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ha-I'm not Kyle, I'm Butters. I thought you were Kyle.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No, I'm Stan.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You're Stan? Where's Kenny?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Who are you?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'm Kyle.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Heheh, guess who I am, guys?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle, I think we may have gotten into something bad here.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What do you mean? We're learning all kinds of cool stuff.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Look at us, dude. These people are trying to change us somehow. I think it's time we went home.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: But David Blaine is gonna do more miracles in Denver tomorrow..

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I don't care! I'm leaving!  'Scuse me.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Where are you going?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'm going home.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You don't want to go home.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You said we're free to leave whenever we want

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You are.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Move out of the way.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'm not in the way. You are. Are you unhappy with the Church's teachings? Let's just talk about it

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I don't wanna talk about it, I jus' wanna leave.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Why don't we go into the back room for a second, and talk? Then you can leave.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's okay, I... I changed my mind. I'm... gonna stay.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's great news.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, dorm, night. Stan peers out from a door into a hall.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Okay, it's all clear.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What are we doing?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: We're getting out of here. This whole thing has gotten way out of hand.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Whoa whoa, I'm not going anywhere.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Come on, Kyle, this is stupid!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It's not stupid, Stan. For once in my life I feel like I'm part of something.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: A part of what?! Some gaywad magician's crazy life plan?!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Don't call Mr. Blaine a gaywad! He's a brlliant man

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No, they just convinced you that he's a brilliant man! Let's go!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'm not going anywhere!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Goddamnit, I'm not going with you! I wanna stay here!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Huh? I thought you wanted to leave!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh wait, who am I again?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You're Stan.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh- oh yeah. God- Goddamnnit, hold on a second.  Okay. Now look, dude, I'm getting out of here, and you're a dumbass if you don't come back with me!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Then I guess... I'm a dumbass.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle, please.You-  You're my best friend.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Well, this is what I believe in now, Stan. And if you can't respectr that,... then I guess we're not best friends anymore.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: South Park, next day. Cartman and Kyle walk down a sidewalk visiting houses. They approach a pink house.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hello, ma'am. My name is Kyle. And this is Cartman. We'd like to share our interest in David Blaine with you.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Uh oh. My husband warned me about you Blainiacs. I'm sorry, but I'm a Catholic.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Uh it... doesn't matter, ma'am. Blainetology is for everyone. There are Blainetologists who are Catholics, Buddhists - why even Kyle here is a Goddamn Jew.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's right.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: So you're not a cult?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Of course, no. David Blaine is a real person. You may have seen his television specials on ABC. He also wrote a book, and we'd like to share it with you.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Well, alright, come on in.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cool.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Elderly woman's house, living room, moments later. The woman and the two boys sit on the sofa. Kyle has his book open.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: ...And if you look here, you can see how David Blaine performed the miracle of being frozen in ice at Times Square.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ma'am, have you ever wondered what David Blaine's plan is for you?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No, not really.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, you see, that, that's inteesting because... I'm so thankful for David Blaine's book, and, I'm so thankful that he showed me the way to true happiness but, I think about his plan often.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: David Blaine is doing a big performance in Denver tomorrow night.  We're sure his magic will entertain and astound you!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He's going to eat his own head.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: How many tickets can we put you down for?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, I can't go.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, come on, it'll make you a happy person.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I am happy.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No you're not.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yes I am.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No you're not.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I really am.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No you're not.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: But I am.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No you're not.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Alright, two tickets

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Great!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sidewalk. Kyle and Cartman exit the elderly woman's house

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's 15 people we got to agree to come see David Blaine perform in Denver.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yes, Brother Kyle hmm, but our work is not over. We must still recruit ten more audience members in order to get the prize.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I think if we try Kenny's neighborhood, we might find a-

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Come, Brother Kyle, we have no time for him.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: HaaAAAA!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You'd better watch yourself next time, abandoner!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus' house, next day. Stan walks up and rings the doorbell

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hi, Jesus. It's me,

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Stan Marsh.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Of course. I know you, my child. Come in.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus' house, living room. A pitcher of water sits on the coffee table

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: This guy is going around doing magic tricks and saying they're miracles! My friend Kyle thinks he's totally awesome!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You're good to bring this to my attention, Stan. Cults are a very dangerous thing.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I read in the Bible that you did miracles, too. If you could go in front of these people and do your miracles, then, they'll all see that David Blaine isn't so special.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The miracle I'm most famous for is turning water into wine.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Can you do it agian?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Very well. I shall perform the miracle. Behold. Here you can see ordinary water, clear, clean. Okay now, turn around. Er, nuh, tur- turn around.  Uh, okay now, turn back.  It is now wine!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's it? That's how you did that trick?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wuh well, yeah.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That trick sucks, Jesus.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh. Well, I guess it worked a little better on people 2000 years ago.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Dude, we have to do something. This guy is performing more miracles in Denver tonight. He's gonna get more followers, and it'll be impossible for me to get Kyle out.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Then let's go.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: But dude, I'd I don't think you should do that lame water-to-wine trick.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh,don't worry  I have a few more miracles up my sleeve.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Denver, night. An arena is shown, and the place is packed. Kyle and Cartman are seated in the third row, with around Blainetologists around them

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: This is a really good turnout.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: And now, ladies and gentlemen, David Blaine.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hello, my children.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ladies and gentlemen, may we have silence, please, as magician David Blaine will now eat... his... own... head.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Dude, no way!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Thank you, everyone.  Our organization grows larger every day. Soon, the government will even have to give us tax-exempt status as a bona fide religion.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hold!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It's Jesus!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What's he doin' here?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: My children, it is time for you to go home and stop following this false prophet. You should be using your money and time for other things. These are simple magic tricks. His magic is interesting, but will it put food on your table? Feeding the hungry - now that is a miracle! Behold! I havd here fives loaves of bread and three fish. Certainly not enough to feed this entire crowd, but now - turn around  Ya need tuh- turn around.  Okay, now turn back.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Now how the hell did he do that?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wow!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Your magic is old and outdated, Jesus! twah. Just like you are.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, really. Then what's this  Ace of Spades doing behind your ear?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Whoa.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus Christ!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He's incredible!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The old religions have failed you! twah. What have they offered except for war, poverty, and sadness? Blainetology offers you the key to living your life to the fullest! Will you join us?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yes!!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The arena, outside. Jesus and Stan exit the arena

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: His magic is too powerful, Stanley. I've never seen anything like it.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Then what are we going to do.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I cannot face him alone. We must get the help of all the super best friends. Buddha. Buddha, come in!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Super best friends?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: This is Buddha, Jesus. Go ahead.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: A futuristic headquarters, somewhere... Jesus appears on a giant screen as Buddha awaits Jesus' answer

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Buddha, we may have a problem. I've just encountered a magic I've never seen before.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I'll call everyone together. Come as fast as you can.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Come, Stanley. We must travel far and long.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: To where?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Distances unfathomable to man. Yea, take hold of my robe, Stanley, and do not open your eyes.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I am ready.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Insde an airplane. Jesus and Stan have center seats, and Stan's eyes are still shut

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Are you still keeping your eyes clsoed?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yeah.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Good. Want some peanuts?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, night. Blainetologists gather in the main room, and a new member is having his hair shaved off

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Congratulations, sister. You have heard the noble truth and are now a Blainetologist.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Everyone! Everyone, gather 'round! I have great news for all Blainetologists, and for our new members as well. We've just gotten word from Mr. Blaine himself: The government has denied our church's request for tax-exempt status!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: But... we want tax-exempt status.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yeah. Why is that good news?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Be-cause! Mr. Blaine has arranged for all Blainetologists members from every city and state to march into Washington and demand our right for tax-exepmt status by committing a mass suicide!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mass suicide?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mr. Blaine has said that by killing ourselves in Washington, we are guaranteed everylasting happiness in the afterlife!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hehehe, that sounds good.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Get your thngs ready. We leave for Washington at dawn!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Did you hear that, guys? We're finally gonna die!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: A blue sky in a big city. The camera pans down to show Jesus and Stan in a park-like setting

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Alright, Stanley. You can open your eyes now.  This is the hall of the super best friends, Stanley, the headquarters for those who stand for what's right.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus, we've been working hard since we got your distress call!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Who the kid?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Stanley, I want you to meet some of the super best friends : Buddha, with the powers of invisibility; Mohammed, the Muslim prophet with the powers of flame ; Krishna, the Hindu deity; Jospeh Smith, the Mormom prophet; Lao Tse, the found of Taoism ; and Sea-Man, with the ability to breathe underwater and link mentally with fish.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: So you mean to tell me that even though people fight and argue over different religions, you guys are all actually friends?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: More than friends, young boy, we are super best friends, with the desire to fight for justice.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: We all believe in the power of good over evil. Except for Buddha, of course, who doesn't believe in evil.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wow.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus, come look at this.  After your distress call, we entered David Blaine in the super best friends' computer.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Many interesting things showed up. He was raised in New York city by a decent family, but a freak washing-machine accident at the age of 12 made him learn the ways of the black arts.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That's right, Seaman.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sea Man!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Uh that's what I said. Sea Man.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Stop it!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, dorm, night. Kyle walks up to Cartman's bunk.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cartman! Cartman, wake up! Cartman!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: No, Paula Poundstone! Leave me alone! Eyuh! Uh?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It's jsut me.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Brother Kyle? Why do you disturb my rest?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Dude. I don't think I wanna be a part of this anymore.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I think Stan might've been right. Anyway, I think it's going too far. I mean, if I kill myself, it's gonna make my family really sad.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yeah, I know what you mean. I don't wanna die either.  I haven't even gotten my pubes yet.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I thnk we should bail. If we leave the group, maybe other people will get the courage to leave, too.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That co- ugh.  That could be difficult, Brother Kyle. But alright, listen: Why don't we sleep on it? If we decide to leave the faction, we can... do it in the morning.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Okay. Okay, you're right.  Oh uh Cartman: thanks.  Cartman?  What the hell?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The David Blaine Complex, main room. The Blainetologists and Cartman look on.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I told on yoo-ou. I told on yoo-ou.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What have you done, Cartman?!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: This is for your own good, Brother Kyle.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You must understand, brother Kyle, twah, you know too much about the Church. If you left now, you'd become a danger to our cause.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ah, and you know what else Kyle said? Um Kyyyle, he said that if we were all gonna commit suicide, that he wouldn't do iiit.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cartman, you fatass tattle-tale!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: At least I'm not the boy in the plastic bubble!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The suicide pact will go as planned. If we die, we all die together.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: the Hall of the Super Best Friends, day.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Meanwhile, at the Hall of Super Best Friends...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Look at that, Jesus. His followers are growing at a rate even faster than mine! It appears this David Blaine is as dangerous as you and your young friend had feared.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I knew it.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Here. I have a videotape of his performance the other night.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Perhaps we should have Moses look at the tape and see what he comes up with.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Moses, scan this tape. Can you tell us the source of Blaine's power?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Give me the information.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wow, the Moses.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: His magic is a combination of centrifugal line and sleight of hand. Wait a minute: I'm picking up movement from Blainetologists from all over the country.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The Blainetologists are heading to Washington. But why?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wait a minute. At his performance David Blaine said something about trying to get tax-exempt status.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Omigod!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: If he gets tax-exempt status, then he'll become a real religion.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He would become unstoppable

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Washington D.C., day. The Blainetologists have gathered around the Reflecting Pool in front of the Lincoln Memorial

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Meanwhile, in the nation's capital, Blainetologists from all over the country have gathered to commit mass suicide!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: If the government will not give us tax-exempt status, then we must prove that we are willing to die for our beliefs, twah.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Alright, brothers and sisters, gather around.  It's time to drown ourselves in the Reflecting Pool!  However, the-ah Reflecting Pool is a little more shallow than we originally thought, so to drown ourselves, you will need to lie on your stomach, face down, until you die, as such.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Next!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The White House, day. The White House staff gathers at one of the windows to watch. Shown are Princess, Luara and George W. Bush, Karl Rove, and Maggie

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Meanwhile, at the White House...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mr. President, we can't let them all kill themselves!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Well we can't give them tax-exempt status, either, Karl!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He-e-ey George! What's gon' on?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Washington D.C., day. Cartman gets ready to flood Kyle, who's still in the glass dome, with a fire hose. More corpses float in the Reflecting Pool

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Alright, Brother Kyle, it is time for us to die!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cartman! We've been brainwashed, don't you see? We don't have to do this!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: But it's the only way for us to be happy.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Cartman, no!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The Reflecting Pool, later

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Give us what we want or we will continue to die

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Not so fast, David Blaine!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Jesus! Not again.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Yes! But this time, I've brought some help! Super Best Friends!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Buddha!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Mohammed!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Joseph Smith!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Krishna!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Lao Tse!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sea-Man!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The mass suicide is over, Blaine! And so are you!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I don't think so. Get them!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: My ice breath should take care of you.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle! Kyle!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sweet Salvation!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle??  Oh my God, they've killed Kenny!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You bastards!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle?  Oh my God, they've killed Kenny!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You bastards!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh my God, they've killed Kenny!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That takes care of them.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Now it's your turn, Blaine!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Perhaps you need to see some real magic.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Raaargh!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh this looks like trouble.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: So long, Super Best Fools!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Stan!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle, you can't kill yourself!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I don't want to kill myself. They rigged this thing to fill with water!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: We've gotta stop that oversized Abraham Lincoln! Mohammed!  Great Scott!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Bliegh!  Yugh. Uh, okay, try agian. Hep .

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Shot of Washington D.C. from the Vietnam Memorial. Lincoln is taking buildings off their foundations and tossing them aside. Krishna, in the form of an eagle, flies over the scene. Flames are everywhere.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It is too powerful, Jesus!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It seems to have no weakness!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: There has to be a way to destroy it. Jesus to Moses!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The Hall of Super Best Friends, day, at that moment

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Meanwhile, at the Super Best Friends League...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Come in, Moses!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: What?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: We need to know how to kill a giant stone Abraham Lincoln.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: ...Um... Let me think, um... a giant stone John Wilkes Booth?

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: You heard him, Super Best Friends! We've got to make a giant stone John Wilkes Booth!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Krishna, we're going to need wood for a mold!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Form of... a beaver!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: I will find sources to concrete.  You, get the water to mix it with, Seaman.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Using the wood that Krishna cut down as a beaver, Jesus uses his master carpentry skills to make a giant mold.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: That should do the trick. Now for some concrete.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Meanwhile, in the ocean depths, Seaman seeks out water to mix with the concrete.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Sea-Man!  Look, Swallow, we should be able to divert the water with that pipe.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: And so, Seaman and Swallow get to... get to work

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The Reflecting Pool, later. Water fills the bubble Kyle is in, and he struggles to breathe

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Kyle, you have to hold yoru breath! Oh, very funny!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Lao Tse, bring it to life.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Using his power of Taoism, Lao Tse becomes one with the giant stone John Wilkes Booth.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Wagh.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It worked. Now freeze over the pool so no one else can drown themselves!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Hey, I was just about to do it.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: The Reflecting Pool, later. The crowd of Blainetologists is still there, and the water has melted

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Later, at the exact same location...

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Damn you, Super Best Friends!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Your magic is no match for our powers combined, Blaine!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Then I guess you win this time, Super Best Fools! But I'll be back!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Goddamnit!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: It's alright. Everything is as it should be.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, shut up, Buddha!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Our leader, he... he's leaving us!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Don't leave us, David Blaine!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Listen up, everyone!  You don't need David Blaine to tell you how to live. See, cults are dangerous because they promise you hope, happiness and, maybe even an afterlife. But in return, they demand you pay money. Any religion that requires you to pay money in order to move up and... learn its tenets is wrong. See, all religions have something valuable to teach, but, just like the Super Best Friends learned, it requires a little bit of them all.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: He's right. He... he's right!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Thanks for savign us Stan. You're my Super Best Friend.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Your my Super Best Friend too, Kyle.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Oh, that's so sweet you guys.  You wanna go get a room so you can make out for a while? Heheheheheh

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Haha, hehahaha.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Ah!  Ow, stop it!  Ah!

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: Well, it looks like everything worked out.

title: THE SUPER BEST FRIENDS
text: And so, Jesus and his companios leave Washington. But their return is assured, for there will always be a need for... the Super Best Friends!
